entry.title: I'm Stuck Like Glue (To My Guy)
entry.summary:
Author: thatsthefrailtyofgenius

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,444Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: “Diaz, you are hoarding Buckley?” His brain short circuits. “Gonna need you to give me context, Roz, we’ve talked about this.” “Is not hard to understand. You are making Buckley late for Rozhdestvo shift.” “No, the fuck I’m not! I didn’t even – shit, I didn’t even know he was working tonight. He’s – he hasn’t turned up?” Eddie feels an age-old panic curl in his gut. “Is okay, you are old man now, hearing problems are common. I will say louder for you. You are making Buckley late for-” “Jesus Christ, Rozanov,” Eddie growls down the phone.Or - Buck signs on to work the first Christmas since Bobby died because no one asks him to spend it with them. This, of course, means he stops to help a damsel in vehicular distress and ends up tied to a pipe in a basement. Of course, how else would it have gone?

entry.title: your hands are the remedy
entry.summary:
Author: maarbley

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 673Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 39

Summary: Eddie opens the door with great struggle. The key is just so small and the keyhole even smaller and his hands are shaking. The crow’s steady kaw kaw kaw around him is not in the slightest helpful and makes him want to rip his hair out. He refrains from the action since his hands are preoccupied with the too small key. Eddie could swear the crows are laughing at him when he misses once more. See if he tosses them any more grains, bastards. He allows himself a small grunt of victory when the door finally opens. With eyes half closes – why on earth were the lights so bright, were they always so bright – Eddie tosses the keys onto what hopefully is the side table. He stumbles forward in the direction of the couch and promptly sprawls over it, ignoring the couches indignant ow.Or, Eddie has a migraine. He is grumpy about it. A Buck-shaped couch saves the day.

entry.title: May This Journey Lead You Starward, and All The Way Home: A 9-1-1/Honkai Star Rail crossover
entry.summary:
Author: WTFDavey730

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,083Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 39

Summary: The aftermath of the lawsuit was brutal on everyone, and everyone involved was hurt one way or another. So for the past few weeks, Buck kept a low profile when he came back, kept everything on a subdued level, as to not step on anyone's toes. Weeks turned into a month, then it became months. Buck tried bridging the gap, tried every type of olive branch, but no one would take it. Hen was at least polite when she declined; Chimney would scoff at him, Eddie ignored him, and Bobby kept their relationship purely professional. But one night changed everything.

entry.title: the feelings jar
entry.summary:
Author: madforyou

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,808Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 60

Summary: Day twenty-three, change of tactics. I feel like you both are being dumb. Dad unfolds this one and reads it and stops and reads it again like he's hoping the words will rearrange themselves into something less insulting. "Excuse me?" "It's my feeling." Chris spears a dumpling with his chopsticks. "You can't argue with my feeling, that's not how therapy works." "I can ask for clarification on what you mean." "Clarification about what? It's very clear. You—" he points at Dad, "both—" he swings to point at Buck, "dumb. Three words. Simple sentence structure. I learned about that in English class." Or,Chris weaponizes his therapy homework to make his emotionally constipated dad admit he's in love with Buck.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 593,310Chapters: 64/?Kudos: 80

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 385,510Chapters: 57/?Kudos: 25

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 233,093Chapters: 40/?Kudos: 22

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: you called me home
entry.summary:
Author: thequeenofwhump

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 87,804Chapters: 10/14Kudos: 428

Summary: Running to the frontlines from a childhood he never had. Taking a bat to the wall with his son in the next room. Having an affair with the spitting image of his dead wife. Eddie knows he’s never been good at grieving, knows he’s never been good at losing what little he allows for himself in the first place. This is why he also knows his coping mechanisms can’t possibly get any worse. Buck, as he so often does, makes him reevaluate his assumptions.—Evan Buckley dies behind a wall of glass. It’s a shame that when he’s revived not three minutes later, no one is informed.

entry.title: I'm breaking the silence to say-
entry.summary:
Author: titaniclikeship003

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,296Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 22

Summary: in 10 years, when im 27, will all of this make more sense? Or will it make less? Will I look back with older eyes and understand? Or look back with a dimmed spirit? More broken than I am now?  Will I have found you by then? in 10 years will you know my name?  I hope.  That’s why i wrote this. My sister says that if you write a letter to someone you love, they if they love you back, they’ll respond.  will you respond?

entry.title: Homebound
entry.summary:
Author: jujububu159

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,633Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 7

Summary: At first, Eddie’s concern eased - maybe Buck’s phone had died and he had gone to meet Maddie. But all hope left him when he opened the note: I’m fine, don’t worry about me.I’ll be okay. Eddie’s heart raced. What did Buck mean, “I’ll be okay”? Of course he was okay—he was with Chris and Eddie. ORBuck is spiraling and needs out, he needs to fill the empty space that was left when Bobby passed. He takes a more drastic approach to this leaving Eddie trying to find a way to make Buck see that what he is missing is in front of him, in LA.

entry.title: Blessings They Call Sins
entry.summary:
Author: Annabellee86

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,171Chapters: 14/30Kudos: 175

Summary: When firefighter Eddie Diaz arrives at LA's Station 118, he's determined to keep his walls up and his past in Texas buried. But his new partner Buck has a way of slipping past his defenses, becoming not just a trusted colleague but a best friend who Eddie and his son Christopher can't imagine life without. As their bond deepens, Eddie finally feels safe enough to share his truth – he's a trans man who fled Texas after a brutal custody battle for Christopher. Buck's unconditional acceptance and steadfast support through a difficult family visit begin to heal old wounds, even as it stirs deeper feelings between them. Their growing attraction is complicated by Buck's dawning realization about his own sexuality and Eddie's fear of being seen as an experiment. But when love and trust are tested by misunderstandings and past trauma, they must decide if their chosen family is worth fighting for. A tender story about the courage to be seen, the power of unconditional love, and the family we build through choice rather than blood.

entry.title: dance with me (just hold me close)
entry.summary:
Author: maarbley

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,158Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 61

Summary: “Are we uh, slow dancing?” Buck asks confused. “It’s easy to teach and you have two left legs when dancing sober. Now be quiet and follow my movements.” “Mean” Buck mumbles but he doesn’t try to argue. Besides he can’t be that upset when he gets to hold Eddie in his arms. It’s kind of distracting honestly, having Eddie pressed so closely to his chest. He is sure he has stepped on Eddies toes more then once already, but he has a weird feeling that Eddie is kind of distracted too. Or maybe not that distracted. Eddie acts very bitchy and bossy right now, actually.  Or, Buck and Eddie and their attempt at a dance at a cost of Bucks groceries and Eddies laughter.
